TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit MediaCodecInfo/CodecCapabilities extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: Encapsulates the capabilities of a given codec component, i.e. what profile/level combinations it supports and what colorspaces it is capable of providing the decoded data in.

remarks.para: Encapsulates the capabilities of a given codec component, i.e. what profile/level combinations it supports and what colorspaces it is capable of providing the decoded data in.

Docs.summary: Defined in the OpenMAX IL specs, color format values are drawn from OMX_COLOR_FORMATTYPE.

remarks.para: Defined in the OpenMAX IL specs, color format values are drawn from OMX_COLOR_FORMATTYPE.

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
